Package io.github.ai4ci.abm

Interface PersonState

All Superinterfaces:
Abstraction.TemporalState<Person>, PersonTemporalState, Serializable
@Immutable public interface PersonState extends PersonTemporalState
The person's current state within a single simulation timestep.

This interface represents the mutable, per-timestep view of a person used during the update cycle. It holds transmissibility, mobility, compliance and app use modifiers, transient quantities such as importation exposure and immunisation dose, and references to the InHostModelState and RiskModel instances associated with the person. Implementations are typically generated by the Immutables library and provide derived or lazy values for properties that are computed from the person's history.

Behavioural decisions (for example changes to mobility or compliance) are made by classes in the io.github.ai4ci.abm.behaviour package and may update the modifiers exposed by this interface. State update helpers live in StateUtils and the model navigation helpers used in many methods are available via ModelNav.

Notes about timing: many accessor methods consult the person's historical records via ModelNav.history(PersonState); where the javadoc notes that a method is "one day behind" this reflects that the history available during the update pass does not yet include the values being computed for the current timestep.

Author:
Rob Challen

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final double
    MAX_EXPOSURE
    The maximum exposure an individual can experience in a single day in normalised units, where 1 is an average dose and 0 is the minimum.

  • Field Details

    • MAX_EXPOSURE

      static final double MAX_EXPOSURE
      The maximum exposure an individual can experience in a single day in normalised units, where 1 is an average dose and 0 is the minimum. Values greater than this are clipped to avoid undue numerical instability when aggregating multiple exposures.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getAbsoluteComplianceDecrease

      default double getAbsoluteComplianceDecrease()
      A derived value of the decrease in compliance from the baseline.
      Returns:
      the absolute compliance decrease (baseline - current)

    • getAbsoluteMobilityDecrease

      default double getAbsoluteMobilityDecrease()
      A derived value of the decrease in mobility from the baseline. This is a probability difference (baseline - current).
      Returns:
      the absolute mobility decrease

    • getAdjustedAppUseProbability

      default double getAdjustedAppUseProbability()
      A derived value of the probability of app use. This combines the baseline adoption probability and the individual's app use modifier. Behavioural adjustments to app use should modify the app use modifier.
      Returns:
      probability of using the app today

    • getAdjustedCompliance

      default double getAdjustedCompliance()
      A derived value of the probability of compliance to guidance. This is a combination of the baseline probability and the individual's compliance modifier. Behaviour models may modify the modifier; the daily observed compliance is sampled from this value by isCompliant().
      Returns:
      probability of compliance today

    • getAdjustedMobility

      default double getAdjustedMobility()
      Probability of contact given a fully mobile partner on a per day basis. This combines baseline mobility with the individual's mobility modifier and is used by the contact generation process. Behavioural models may update the modifier; see io.github.ai4ci.abm.behaviour.
      Returns:
      probability of contact with a fully mobile partner

    • getAdjustedTransmissibility

      default double getAdjustedTransmissibility()
      A derived value of the probability of transmission given an encounter with a completely unprotected person. This combines the model's transmissibility baseline (which depends on viral load) with global and individual transmissibility modifiers.
      Returns:
      probability of transmission in an unprotected contact

    • getAppUseModifier

      @Default default double getAppUseModifier()
      An odds ratio that modifies the baseline probability the person is using the smartphone app. Behavioural code may modify this to reflect adoption or abandonment of the app.
      Returns:
      an odds ratio of app use (1.0 = no change)

    • getBehaviour

      @Lazy default String getBehaviour()
      A simple textual representation of the person's current behavioural state. Derived from the entity's state machine state name and intended primarily for export or logging.
      Returns:
      the behaviour state name

    • getComplianceModifier

      @Default default double getComplianceModifier()
      An odds ratio of compliance that modifies the baseline probability that the person will follow guidance. This is a target for change by the behaviour model and is sampled by isCompliant() to produce the daily compliant flag.
      Returns:
      an odds ratio of compliance (1.0 = no change)

    • getContactCount

      default long getContactCount()
      A contact count for the current day derived from the person's history. This is the true number of contacts made today, not an observed count.
      Returns:
      true contact count for today

    • getContactExposure

      @Lazy default double getContactExposure()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      The viral exposure an individual experienced in a day as a result of all contacts in the model. This value is accumulated from Contact events and may also include a random chance of exposure due to importation, as defined by the simulation's contact and importation models. This value should be on the same scale as the viral load for consistent comparison. This value is derived from the contact network and the in-host models and is computed from the person's history (thus it is one day behind during the update pass).
      Specified by:
      getContactExposure in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      The total viral exposure for the day, which may be 0 if no exposure occurred.

    • getContactHistory

      default Stream<Contact> getContactHistory()
      Reassemble the weighted contacts from the history within the expected infectious period. This returns the true contact history (not filtered for detection) and is therefore not the app's observed contact list.
      Returns:
      stream of past contacts within the infectious window

    • getExposureCount

      default long getExposureCount()
      A count of true infectious contacts made today (not filtered by detection). Uses the day's exposures list length.
      Returns:
      count of infectious exposures today

    • getExposureHistory

      default Stream<Exposure> getExposureHistory()
      Reassemble the exposures from the history within the infectious period. This is the true exposure history and not necessarily what the app would observe.
      Returns:
      stream of exposures within the infectious window

    • getImmuneActivity

      default double getImmuneActivity()
      A derived value of immune activity from the in-host model. Range is typically between 0 and 1.
      Returns:
      immune activity derived from the in-host model

    • getImmunisationDose

      @Default default double getImmunisationDose()
      An immunisation dose is a fraction of dormant immune cells that are activated by any immunising exposure in the previous day. Setting this non-zero implies the person received an immunising event at this time point; it is cleared by the updater after each timestep.
      Returns:
      an immunisation dose (0.0 = none)

    • getImportationExposure

      @Default default double getImportationExposure()
      A viral exposure due to importation drivers. This value is transient and is cleared by the updater after it has been consumed for the current timestep; methods that refer to historical exposures will therefore be working one day behind.
      Returns:
      importation exposure for the current timestep

    • getInHostModel

      InHostModelState<?> getInHostModel()
      The in-host state model is updated during the update cycle by calling InHostModelState.update(Person, Sampler). The in-host model provides viral load, severity and immune activity used throughout the infection and behaviour logic.
      Returns:
      the in-host state model

    • getLastResult

      @Lazy default Optional<TestResult> getLastResult()
      The single most recent test with an available result, excluding pending results.
      Returns:
      most recent test result if available

    • getLastTest

      @Lazy default Optional<TestResult> getLastTest()
      Most recent (relevant) test whether or not there is a result. This returns the most recently sampled test even if its result is pending.
      Returns:
      most recent test (if any)

    • getMobilityModifier

      @Default default double getMobilityModifier()
      An odds ratio of mobility that modifies the baseline contact probability. Behavioural code may change this modifier to reflect reduced or increased contacts.
      Returns:
      an odds ratio of mobility (1.0 = no change)

    • getNormalisedSeverity

      default double getNormalisedSeverity()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      A continuous value for the severity of disease, as determined by the in-host model. This value is interpreted relative to disease cutoffs, which are calibrated during the model setup (e.g., in Outbreak's SetupConfiguration). It is not strictly normalized but provides a relative measure of disease progression.
      Specified by:
      getNormalisedSeverity in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      A severity value, where higher values indicate more severe disease. The interpretation of this value is relative to predefined thresholds for symptoms, hospitalisation, and mortality.

    • getNormalisedViralLoad

      default double getNormalisedViralLoad()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      A continuous value for the viral load of disease, as determined by the in-host model. This is scaled such that it is 0 if uninfected and 1 if minimally infectious. Values smaller than 1 imply that viral load may be detectable by tests but not necessarily infectious. This scaling may be revisited to more formally relate viral load with infectivity, potentially referencing parameters in Outbreak's SetupConfiguration.
      Specified by:
      getNormalisedViralLoad in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      A normalized viral load value, where 0 indicates no infection and 1 indicates the threshold for minimal infectivity, it has no upper bound. Values between 0 and 1 represent varying levels of viral load, with higher values indicating greater potential infectivity.

    • getPresumedLocalPrevalence

      @Lazy default double getPresumedLocalPrevalence()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      An estimate of the local prevalence as perceived by a smart agent, calculated based on the probability of infection in today's contacts. This estimation typically involves aggregating information from observed contacts and applying a heuristic or model to infer local infection rates. Estimate local prevalence for an individual as the average presumed probability infectious across detected contacts. If there are no detected contacts a small non-zero floor is returned to avoid zero prevalence issues in downstream calculations.
      Specified by:
      getPresumedLocalPrevalence in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      a probability value representing the smart agent's estimate of local prevalence ,

    • getProbabilityInfectiousToday

      default double getProbabilityInfectiousToday()
      The risk this individual is infectious today as estimated by the risk model. This value comes from RiskModel.getProbabilityInfectiousToday().
      Returns:
      probability the person is infectious today (model estimate)

    • getRecentRuleOutTests

      default Stream<TestResult> getRecentRuleOutTests()
      All the tests done in the last incubation period. These results can be used to rule out further testing where recent negatives exist.
      Returns:
      stream of tests within the incubation window

    • getRiskModel

      @Default default RiskModel getRiskModel()
      The risk model is updated automatically by the updater during the second phase of the update cycle using RiskModel.update(). The risk model estimates the probability the person is infectious today from observable data (symptoms, tests, detected contacts) and is used by behaviour models and testing strategies.
      Returns:
      the risk model (initialised from the person's entity).

    • getStillRelevantTests

      default Stream<TestResult> getStillRelevantTests()
      All tests in the last presumed infectious period (including pending results). These inform simple rules used by strategies to infer current infection status.
      Returns:
      stream of recent tests (most recent first)

    • getSusceptibilityModifier

      @Default default double getSusceptibilityModifier()
      An odds ratio that modifies the baseline probability of becoming infected (susceptibility). This is separate from the transmissibility modifier to allow asymmetric interventions (for example protection of the recipient but not the infector).
      Returns:
      an odds ratio of susceptibility (1.0 = no change)

    • getTotalExposure

      default double getTotalExposure()
      A derived value of the total exposure for the day, equal to the sum of contact and importation exposures. This reflects the total viral dose that the in-host model will observe for the next timestep.
      Returns:
      total exposure for the day

    • getTransmissibilityModifier

      @Default default double getTransmissibilityModifier()
      An odds ratio of transmission that modifies the baseline probability of transmission from this individual to another person. Behaviour models may change this to represent interventions such as mask wearing.
      Returns:
      an odds ratio of transmissibility (1.0 = no change)

    • getTrueLocalPrevalence

      @Lazy default double getTrueLocalPrevalence()
      How many people in this person's recent contacts are infectious regardless of whether the contact is detected. This integrates over approximately one infectious period and therefore is lagged.
      Returns:
      true local prevalence measured as fraction infectious among contacts

    • isCompliant

      @Derived default boolean isCompliant()
      Is the person compliant to guidance on this day? This is sampled from getAdjustedCompliance() and cached for the day. Dead people cannot be compliant.
      Returns:
      true if compliant today

    • isContinuation

      default boolean isContinuation(Predicate<PersonTemporalState> test, int limit)
      Has the event happened continuously for at least limit days.
      Parameters:
      test - predicate testing the event on a temporal state
      limit - the number of previous days to require continuity
      Returns:
      true if the event has continued for at least limit days

    • isDead

      @Derived default boolean isDead()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      Determines if the person is deceased. This state is typically set when the person's disease severity surpasses a mortality threshold or a specific mortality event occurs within the simulation, as defined in the in-host model and Outbreak's SetupConfiguration.
      Specified by:
      isDead in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      true if the person is dead, false otherwise.

    • isIncident

      default boolean isIncident(Predicate<PersonTemporalState> test, int limit)
      Abstract detection of an incident event. This routine determines if an event recorded in the current state is the first occurrence within a left-censored window of length limit days. It relies on the presence of a copied record in the entity's history.
      Parameters:
      test - predicate testing the event on a temporal state
      limit - lookback window in days (0 => today only)
      Returns:
      true if the event is incident within the window

    • isIncidentDeath

      @Lazy default boolean isIncidentDeath()
      Did this person die on this time step. This returns true when the current derived dead state is true and there is no record of death in yesterday's history.
      Returns:
      true if newly dead today, false otherwise

    • isIncidentExposure

      @Lazy default boolean isIncidentExposure()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      Indicates if this PersonTemporalState represents the first day of a new exposure episode. An incident exposure is typically defined as the first day a person experiences any Exposure after a period of no exposure, or after a sufficiently long period to consider it a new episode, as determined by the simulation's exposure tracking logic.
      Specified by:
      isIncidentExposure in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      true if this is an incident exposure, false otherwise.

    • isIncidentHospitalisation

      @Lazy default boolean isIncidentHospitalisation()
      Is this person newly needing hospitalisation on this day or part of an existing hospital episode. The window for considering a previous hospitalisation is the model's symptom duration as returned by the in-host calibration.
      Returns:
      true if newly needing hospitalisation today, false otherwise

    • isIncidentInfection

      @Lazy default boolean isIncidentInfection()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      Indicates if this PersonTemporalState represents the first day the person becomes infectious in a new infection episode. This is distinct from merely being exposed. An incident infection occurs when the person's PersonTemporalState.getNormalisedViralLoad() crosses the infectivity threshold for the first time in a given infection cycle, as defined by the in-host model and Outbreak's SetupConfiguration.
      Specified by:
      isIncidentInfection in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      true if this is an incident infection, false otherwise.

    • isInfectious

      @Derived default boolean isInfectious()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      Determines if the person's internal viral load is above the threshold for potential infectivity. This is calculated by comparing the value returned by PersonTemporalState.getNormalisedViralLoad() against a predefined infectivity threshold, which is typically configured within the Outbreak's SetupConfiguration. A person is considered infectious if their normalized viral load surpasses this threshold.
      Specified by:
      isInfectious in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      true if the person is infectious, false otherwise.

    • isLastTestExactly

      default boolean isLastTestExactly(TestResult.Result result)
      Determine whether the most recent test is of a particular result. The check consults the most recent relevant tests window and compares the test result from the previous day (history is lagged during updates).
      Parameters:
      result - the result to compare against
      Returns:
      true if the most recent test result equals the specified result

    • isRecentlyTested

      default boolean isRecentlyTested(TestResult.Type type)
      Has the person had a test of a specific type within the incubation period. This is used by testing strategies to avoid redundant tests. The search is performed over the lagged history window and therefore may not include tests sampled during the current update pass.
      Parameters:
      type - the test type
      Returns:
      true if a test of the specified type exists in the incubation window

    • isRecentlyTested

      default boolean isRecentlyTested(TestResult.Type type, int days)
      Look back for tests of the specified type within the given number of days. This function is used by testing strategies to determine if a new test is required.
      Parameters:
      type - the test type
      days - the number of days to look back
      Returns:
      true if a matching test exists within the lookback window

    • isReportedSymptomatic

      @Derived default boolean isReportedSymptomatic()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      The user has reported symptoms via the app. This combines the true symptomatic state and app use for the day and therefore represents an observed report; it is used in prevalence estimates and contact notification, typically through a smart agent mechanism. This state is dependent on PersonTemporalState.isSymptomatic() being true and the person actively reporting their symptoms based on their behavioral model.
      Specified by:
      isReportedSymptomatic in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      true if the person is symptomatic and has reported it, false otherwise.

    • isRequiringHospitalisation

      @Derived default boolean isRequiringHospitalisation()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      Determines if the person's disease severity is high enough to require hospitalisation. This is calculated by comparing the value returned by PersonTemporalState.getNormalisedSeverity() against a predefined hospitalisation threshold, which is typically configured within the Outbreak's SetupConfiguration.
      Specified by:
      isRequiringHospitalisation in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      true if the person requires hospitalisation, false otherwise.

    • isSymptomatic

      @Derived default boolean isSymptomatic()
      Description copied from interface: PersonTemporalState
      Determines if the person's internal infected targets are above the threshold for exhibiting symptoms. This is calculated by comparing the value returned by PersonTemporalState.getNormalisedSeverity() against a predefined symptom threshold, which is typically configured within the Outbreak's SetupConfiguration.
      Specified by:
      isSymptomatic in interface PersonTemporalState
      Returns:
      true if the person is symptomatic, false otherwise.

    • isSymptomaticConsecutively

      default boolean isSymptomaticConsecutively(int days)
      Is a person symptomatic for a number of days in a row? This consults the person's history to determine whether they have been symptomatic for the specified number of days in a row, including today. If days <= 0 this returns false. When used during the update cycle the history is lagged by one day.
      Parameters:
      days - the number of days (including today)
      Returns:
      true if symptomatic for at least the specified consecutive days

    • isUsingAppToday

      @Derived default boolean isUsingAppToday()
      Is the person using the app on this day? Sampled from getAdjustedAppUseProbability() and cached for the day. Dead people cannot use the app.
      Returns:
      true if using the app today
